title: So Ryze's Intro Paragraph's here, and it gives a bit of insight in to Runterra's origins...

body:
> >_ 'Take care with this world. What is made can be unmade.'' _
> Widely considered one of the most adept sorcerers on Runeterra, Ryze is an ancient, hard-bitten archmage with an impossibly heavy burden to bear. Armed with a boundless constitution and a vast array of mystic knowledge, he spends his life searching for World Runes - fragments of the raw magic that once shaped the world from nothingness. He must retrieve these glyphs before they fall into the wrong hands, for though they were once used to create Runeterra, they also have the potential to destroy it.

So apparently the world was forged by an incredibly powerful magic and the remnants of said magic are known as World Runes. Said World Runes are also likely to be the runic power that defined the Rune Wars.

Thoughts people? I feel like we'll definetly get more with Ryze's full lore, but this is an interesting bit of information.

Just a heads-up to add to this particular post - Jaredan answered a question of mine about 'World Runes' on his ask.fm page:

**My Question:**
Ryze's short lore on the PBE mentions world runes and offers a brief description. World runes and their importance was something Tryndamere hinted at 2 years ago but then was never spoken of again until now. How long has this idea been in development and will it become bigger than just about Ryze's

**His Response:**
World Runes have been in our thoughts for a long time. They're central to Ryze's story, but they're not limited to it. I can't say any more than that. Sorry!
Yeah I saw that; I have Jaredan's ask FM in my bookmarks. I'm eager for more info!

Looking at a comparison of our universe to the Runeterra universe, I suppose this does answer one question. If Aurelion Sol has created all the stars but not the planets it was unknown just how planets came into being. In our Universe it is believed that the planets form from the same dust stars do and due to the same forces. However now we know that planets like Valoran are formed from runes of creation. This brings up more questions like "who wielded these runes first?"

However we can look at a few things about Aurelion Sol in a new light
His stance towards magical words and how it just muddles it up
In his flavor story he used caution as to not damage the planet too badly and seemed remorseful to have scarred it.

So we know Aurelion thinks little of magical runes, due to his dialogue, and also holds planetary life in contempt because of Targon. So why would he be remorseful about damaging the planet? I don't think it was because he was worried about being punished for it by Targon (or he wouldn't have melted Pantheon).

As one final set of questions, are all worlds in the Runeterra universe created with the runes of creation, or just the magical ones? How many planets are in Valorans solar system, and are planets common, uncommon, or very rare to find around stars in the Runeterra universe?
We're getting a villain champion next with one of these Runes, aren't we?
It would be interesting. Rito teased as much as the Rune Wars were still a thing in the current lore recently so it could be a segwey (idk how to spell this word)
